org.platanios.learn.math.matrix

Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.math.matrix.Vector
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DenseVector, HashVector, SparseVector

    public abstract class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
    Interface for classes representing vectors and supporting operations related to vectors. TODO: Allow transposing all matrix arguments. TODO: Add vector iterators support (over all elements and nonzero elements only).
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double epsilon
      The threshold value for elements to be considered equal to zero when counting the number of non-zero elements of this vector (i.e., in method cardinality()) and when handling sparse vectors.

      Vector()

      Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without having an underflow or an overflow.

      Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without avoiding an underflow or an overflow.

      Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without avoiding an underflow or an overflow.

      Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without having an underflow or an overflow.

      Computes the inner product (also known as the dot product) between the current vector and another vector.
      abstract Vector map(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> function)
      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and returns it in a new vector.

      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and adding the provided vector to the result, and returns it in a new vector.

      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and adding the provided vector to the result, and replaces the current vector with the result.

      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and the provided vector (the elements of the two vectors with the same index are considered in pairs) and returns it in a new vector.

      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and the provided vector (the elements of the two vectors with the same index are considered in pairs) and replaces the current vector with the result.

      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and dividing the provided vector with the result element-wise, and returns it in a new vector.

      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and dividing the provided vector with the result element-wise, and replaces the current vector with the result.

      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and subtracting the provided vector from the result, and returns it in a new vector.

      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and subtracting the provided vector from the result, and replaces the current vector with the result.

      • epsilon

        protected final double epsilon
        The threshold value for elements to be considered equal to zero when counting the number of non-zero elements of this vector (i.e., in method cardinality()) and when handling sparse vectors.

        public abstract double[] getDenseArray()
        Gets a dense array representation of this vector. This array is completely separate from the inner representation used by the vector implementation.
        Returns:
        A dense array representation of this vector.

      • get

        public abstract double get(int index)
        Gets the value of the vector element at the provided index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the element.
        Returns:
        The value of the element at the provided index.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The provided index must be between 0 (inclusive) and the size of the vector (exclusive).

      • get

        public abstract Vector get(int initialIndex,
                           int finalIndex)
        Gets a sub-vector of this vector.
        Parameters:
        initialIndex - The initial index.
        finalIndex - The final index (inclusive).
        Returns:
        The sub-vector corresponding to the provided indexes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The provided indexes must be between 0 (inclusive) and the size of the vector (exclusive) and the initial index must be smaller or equal to the final index.

        Returns:
        The sub-vector corresponding to the provided indexes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The provided indexes must be between 0 (inclusive) and the size of the vector (exclusive).

                         int finalIndex,
                         Vector vector)
        Sets a sub-vector of this vector to the provided vector values.
        Parameters:
        initialIndex - The initial index.
        finalIndex - The final index (inclusive).
        vector - The vector to whose values we set the values of the specified sub-vector of this vector.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The provided indexes must be between 0 (inclusive) and the size of the vector (exclusive) and the initial index must be smaller or equal to the final index.

                         Vector vector)

        vector - The vector to whose values we set the values of the specified sub-vector of this vector.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The provided indexes must be between 0 (inclusive) and the size of the vector (exclusive).

      • saxpy

        public abstract Vector saxpy(double scalar,
                             Vector vector)
        Performs the saxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a scalar \(\alpha\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function returns the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar \(\alpha\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\).

      • saxpyInPlace

        public abstract Vector saxpyInPlace(double scalar,
                                    Vector vector)
        Performs the saxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK, in-place. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a scalar \(\alpha\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function replaces this vector with the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\) and returns it.
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar \(\alpha\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\).

      • dot

        public final double dot(Vector vector)
        Computes the inner product (also known as the dot product) between the current vector and another vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector used to compute the inner product with the current vector.
        Returns:
        The resulting inner product value.

      • inner

        public abstract double inner(Vector vector)
        Computes the inner product (also known as the dot product) between the current vector and another vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector used to compute the inner product with the current vector.
        Returns:
        The resulting inner product value.

      • hypotenuse

        public abstract Vector hypotenuse(Vector vector)
        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without having an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The result is returned in a new vector. This method is slower than hypotenuseFast(Vector), but it tries to avoid numerical precision errors, while hypotenuseFast(Vector) does not.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to use as vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in the above equation.
        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of this operation.

      • hypotenuseInPlace

        public abstract Vector hypotenuseInPlace(Vector vector)
        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without having an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The current vector is replaced with the result. This method is slower than hypotenuseFastInPlace(Vector), but it tries to avoid numerical precision errors, while hypotenuseFastInPlace(Vector) does not.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to use as vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in the above equation.
        Returns:
        The current vector holding the result of this operation.

      • hypotenuseFast

        public abstract Vector hypotenuseFast(Vector vector)
        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without avoiding an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The result is returned in a new vector. This method is faster than hypotenuse(Vector), but it does not try to avoid numerical precision errors, while hypotenuse(Vector) does try to avoid such errors.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to use as vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in the above equation.
        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of this operation.

      • hypotenuseFastInPlace

        public abstract Vector hypotenuseFastInPlace(Vector vector)
        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without avoiding an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The current vector is replaced with the result. This method is faster than hypotenuseInPlace(Vector), but it does not try to avoid numerical precision errors, while hypotenuseInPlace(Vector) does try to avoid such errors.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to use as vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in the above equation.
        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of this operation.

        A new vector holding the result of the operation.

      • mapSubInPlace

                                     Vector vector)
        Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and subtracting the provided vector from the result, and replaces the current vector with the result.

        vector - The vector to subtract from the function result.

        The current vector holding the result of the operation.

      • outer

        public abstract Matrix outer(Vector vector)
        Computes the outer product between the current vector and another vector and returns the result in a new matrix.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector used to compute the outer product with the current vector.
        Returns:
        A new matrix containing the result of the outer product operation.

      • gaxpy

        public abstract Vector gaxpy(Matrix matrix,
                             Vector vector)
        Performs the gaxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a matrix \(\A\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function returns the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix \(\A\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The row dimension of the matrix must agree with the size of the current vector and the column dimension of the matrix must agree with the size of the provided vector.

      • gaxpyInPlace

        public abstract Vector gaxpyInPlace(Matrix matrix,
                                    Vector vector)
        Performs the gaxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK, in-place. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a matrix \(A\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function replaces this vector with the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\) and returns it.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix \(A\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The row dimension of the matrix must agree with the size of the current vector and the column dimension of the matrix must agree with the size of the provided vector.

      • transMult

        public abstract Vector transMult(Matrix matrix)
        Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a matrix \(\A\), this function returns the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}^{\top}A\).
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix \(A\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}^{\top}A\).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The row dimension of the matrix must agree with the size of the vector.

      • checkVectorSize

        protected void checkVectorSize(Vector vector)
        Checks whether the provided vector has the same size as this vector. If the sizes of the two vectors do not agree an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector whose size to check.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Vector sizes must agree.

                            throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the contents of this vector to the provided output stream.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - The output stream to write the contents of this vector to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • equals

        public abstract boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Compares the current vector with another object for equality. Note that if the provided object is not a vector object, then this method returns false. Otherwise, it checks for equality of the element values of the two vectors, with some tolerance that is equal to the square root of the smallest possible value that can be represented by a double precision floating point number. That tolerance is used because double precision floating point number values are compared.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        object - The object with which to compare this vector.
        Returns:
        True if this vector is equal to the provided object and false if it is not.

        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
